name: unsmoothed
content:
unsmoothed adjective
(SURFACE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unsmoothed surface is rough or irregular, rather than having been made smooth or regular: The edges were left unsmoothed. The structure was covered with stones and sealed with a thick layer of unsmoothed stucco.
More examplesFewer examplesThe walls are made of boulders which are uncut and unsmoothed.

unsmoothed adjective
(NUMBERS)
mathematics
  specialized based on average values or amounts, rather than on unexplained or unexpected values or amounts that are considered less important: The data (smoothed or unsmoothed) suggest a fairly regular pattern. The means were then smoothed, although we also plotted unsmoothed means.
More examplesFewer examplesThe unsmoothed data is shown in Figure 3.
